about-intro: We are a community of artificial intelligence enthusiasts, professionals and researchers in Mexico City.
about-join-text: We participate in meetups, workshops and conferences. Join our channels to stay up to date.
about-mission: Connect and empower the AI community in Mexico through events, networking and educational resources.

card-luma-description: Discover and register for upcoming events.
card-meetup-description: Join our in-person and virtual events.
community-resources-intro: Curated AI, machine learning, and related technology resources recommended by the AI CDMX community.
community-resources-no-results: No resources match the selected filters.
conduct-intro: This space connects the community and depends on useful, relevant conversations carried out in good faith. Follow these rules so everyone can learn without noise.
conduct-rule-share: Share your work, but skip the spam.
conduct-rule-crypto: Get approval before promoting crypto projects.
conduct-rule-invest: No investment clubs or financial schemes.
conduct-rule-respect: Be respectful and keep discussions inclusive.
conduct-rule-value: Add value with each post and stay on AI/tech topics.
conduct-language-note: Check each group's description for specifics, but most allow conversations in both Spanish and English.
footer-copyright: © 2024 AI CDMX. Made with ❤️ in Mexico City.
hero-description: Connecting AI enthusiasts, professionals and researchers in Mexico City.
hero-subtitle: Artificial Intelligence Community in Mexico City
popular-videos-all-description: Browse every live stream we've hosted, regardless of language or topic.
popular-videos-english-description: Talks and sessions with international guests for AI CDMX's global community.
popular-videos-intro: We gathered our live stream playlists so you can rewatch the community's standout conversations.
popular-videos-mots-english-description: Global perspectives captured on the street about AI's real-world impact.
popular-videos-mots-spanish-description: Spontaneous interviews capturing how the Spanish-speaking community experiences AI progress.
popular-videos-spanish-description: Conversations, workshops and panels in Spanish focused on the Latin American AI scene.
speaker-guide-cta-text: Fill out the speaker form with your proposal. We'll reply with tentative dates and next steps.
speaker-guide-cta-title: Ready to tell us your story?
speaker-guide-form-text: When your idea is ready, complete the speaker form and tell us the focus of your story, preferred format, and availability.
speaker-guide-format-1: Personal stories about building, launching, or implementing AI solutions in Mexico or Latin America.
speaker-guide-format-2: Use cases focused on impact (business, social, educational, creative) rather than code.
speaker-guide-format-3: Conversations packed with learnings: what worked, what didn't, and practical tips for the community.
speaker-guide-format-title: What kind of talks we're looking for
speaker-guide-intro: At AI CDMX we celebrate narratives that show how artificial intelligence impacts people, communities, and organizations. We look for human stories, real cases, and lessons that inspire every experience level.
speaker-guide-language-text: Talks can be in Spanish or English. Tell us your preference and we'll arrange light translation (introductions, questions) if needed.
speaker-guide-prepare-1: Define the narrative arc: what transformation, challenge, or takeaway should the audience remember?
speaker-guide-prepare-2: Prioritize concrete examples and simple demos instead of long technical slide decks.
speaker-guide-prepare-3: Send us a short bio, headshot, and relevant links at least 10 days before the event.
speaker-guide-prepare-4: If your talk needs a follow-up workshop, list the equipment required and ideal group size.
speaker-guide-stream-text: We stream live on YouTube and then edit short clips for social media. It amplifies your message and lets you revisit the session afterward.
speaker-guide-tech-talks: Want to present a deeply technical talk? We can recommend other excellent communities focused on code and algorithms. We prioritize storytelling and hands-on experience.
speaker-guide-volunteer-link: Want to help in other areas (sponsors, venues, moderation, workshops)? Visit our volunteer page to see every way to collaborate.
speaker-guide-workshops-text: If your topic calls for rolling up sleeves and opening notebooks, propose a workshop. We can help you find space (usually on Saturdays) for 1-3 hour sessions where attendees can bring laptops, practice, and ask questions.
speaker-guide-workshops-title: What if I want to go deeper?
volunteer-card-moderation-text: People who help care for and energize the Discord, Telegram, Signal, or WhatsApp channels, answering questions and sparking conversations.
volunteer-card-resources-text: People who write guides and curate datasets, tutorials, and open tools to grow our Resources page.
volunteer-card-social-text: Content creators, community managers, and storytellers who boost our accounts and digital campaigns.
volunteer-card-speakers-text: People with AI experience who can share talks, demo projects, or lead local panels.
volunteer-card-sponsors-text: Companies and allies who can contribute funding, scholarships, or in-kind support to cover production, sponsor attendees, or bring special guests.
volunteer-card-venues-text: Organizations willing to open their offices, auditoriums, or labs for meetups, workshops, or community cowork sessions.
volunteer-card-workshops-text: Facilitators and mentors designing hands-on experiences for every level, from introductions to advanced projects.
volunteer-cta-text: Write to contact@hablandodeia.com or message us on our social channels with the subject “AI CDMX Volunteer.” We'll be in touch soon.
volunteer-form-text: Share your interests and availability in our general form so we can coordinate volunteer, partnership, and sponsorship opportunities.
volunteer-form-title: Collaborate with AI CDMX / Get involved with AI CDMX
volunteer-how-intro: It doesn't matter if you have a lot or little time. What matters is starting the conversation and finding a format that works for both sides.
volunteer-intro: AI CDMX is a collective effort. We're looking for people and organizations who want to contribute time, talent, or resources to make our events, learning spaces, and digital channels possible.
volunteer-needs-subtitle: If you or your organization identify with any of these areas, we'd love to chat.
volunteer-speaker-note: Want to propose a talk or panel? Complete this speaker form.
volunteer-step-1: Tell us what motivates you: share your experience, availability, and how you'd like to contribute.
volunteer-step-2: Let's define the collaboration together: timeline, objectives, logistics, and how we'll measure impact.
volunteer-step-3: Get activated: we'll connect you with the right team (programming, community, operations, or content) so we can begin.
volunteer-title: Join in so the community grows
faq-subtitle: Everything you need to know about AI CDMX
faq-a-volunteer: Yes! We're looking for people who want to help in various areas: event organization, social media, community moderation, and more.
faq-a-speak: Of course! If you have experience in AI and want to share it with the community, complete our speaker form.
faq-a-sponsor: We're looking for companies and organizations that want to support the community. We offer different sponsorship packages.
faq-q-videos: Where can I watch videos from previous events?
faq-a-videos: We record our events and publish them on our YouTube channel. We also have a selection of featured videos.
faq-q-register-event: How do I register for the next event?
faq-a-register-event: We publish our events on Meetup and Luma. Check the main page to see upcoming events and register.
faq-q-registration-required: Do I have to register to attend?
faq-a-registration-required: Yes, we ask that you register on Meetup or Luma so we can better control capacity and plan the event logistics.
faq-a-free-events: Yes, all our events are completely free. We want AI knowledge to be accessible to the entire community.
faq-q-language: Are the events in Spanish or English?
faq-a-language: Most of our events are in Spanish, although we occasionally have talks in English or bilingual depending on the speaker. We always specify the language in the event description.
faq-contact: Write to contact@hablandodeia.com or contact us on our social media. We'll be happy to help you.
